title: Paul Pogba posts message to Man Utd fans after Newcastle defeat
text:
Paul Pogba is currently sidelined with an ankle injury (Getty Images)

Paul Pogba insists he is working hard to return for Manchester United after videoing part of his recovery session from a rooftop in Dubai.

The World Cup winner has missed United’s last two matches due to an ankle problem as Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s side drew with AZ Alkmaar in the Europa League before they were beaten 1-0 by Newcastle United in the Premier League on Sunday afternoon.

Pogba has been left out of France’s squad for the current international break as he continues to recover from his ankle injury.

And Pogba updated fans after United’s defeat to Newcastle with a post on Instagram which read: ‘They say hard work pay off what about hard work in the heat ? Let’s see, loving the view thoug. Allah always in control.’

The video also showed Pogba’s right ankle heavily bandaged as he worked on an air bike.

Pogba will be aiming to return immediately after the international break as United host Liverpool at Old Trafford on October 20.

And despite his side’s poor run of form and Liverpool currently on a 17-game winning run in the Premier League, Solskjaer says the fixture is ‘perfect’ for United.

‘That’s a perfect game for us,’ Solskjaer said after the defeat to Newcastle.

‘The international break is also at the perfect time because their heads need a bit of airing.

‘They will go away with their national teams, meet their team-mates and come back fresh.

‘We have had a good time together, we have prepared since the first day of pre-season, we have stuck to the same principles.

‘We have not got the result today but we have to keep carrying on.’
